result.execSummary:
The defendant Matthew D. Davel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse - Impairment of Physical Condition, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
The defendant shall pay Department of Correction fees as directed by the agent.  Defendant was ordered to report immediately to the probation and parole office. 2015CM123-counts 1-3 Misdemeanor bail jumping- were dismissed and read-in to this case.
Concurrent with: Probation in 15CM115 to run concurrent with Probation in 15CM21

miscConds.notes: Bond from 15CM115 applied Fine and/or costs to be paid on a schedule established by the agent.

Defendant shall not possess or consume any alcohol, and not go into places that sell alcohol except incidentally such as a grocery store, convenience store or gas station or other such place where alcohol is not sold for consumption on the premises.  

The defendant shall submit to random urine/PBT testing as required by the agent or any law enforcement officer.

The defendant shall have no contact withD.D.  of any kind, whether direct or indirect, including in person, in writing, by phone, by e-mail or other electronic means, through a third party or in any other way without prior approval of the agent and permission of the victim.

timeConds.notes: Jail sentence applies to count 1 only. Defendant granted credit for 45 days served.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to make arrangements to provide a DNA sample, within 48 hours, for testing through the Clark County Sheriff Department or if on probation, to the Department of Corrections as is required in all criminal convictions.  The DNA Surcharge has already been paid   Defendant was granted 129 days credit for time served.
Concurrent with: Jail sentence on Ct 3 in this same case and on case 15CM115 Ct 2
